alert.note: Alert for Lincoln County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 3:11PM PST until February 22 at 4:00PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected with total accumulations of up to 7 inches above 5000 feet. Accumulations of less than 2 inches are expected below 5000 feet. Wind gusts as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Lincoln County. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to slick and snow covered roads and strong winds. Visibility may be reduced due to blowing snow. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong wind gusts are expected across Lincoln County, peaking overnight. The strongest gusts will occur on high terrain. Heavy snow should be confined to elevations above 5000 feet.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous or impossible. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Travel is especially dangerous for lightweight and high profile vehicles. Secure lightweight fixtures and unsecured outdoor objects. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
